posts.name: Batu Altınay
posts.cooked:
Our pdh gives can error altough there is no problem in wiring and other can devices but pdh gives an error how can ı reach to bootloader and reset the pdh. (And also ı atteched a video that shows pdh status lights color.)

Google Drive file.

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked:
How hidden is your CAN wire? The reason I ask this is because there could be a break in your wire that is shorting somewhere.

Does any device show up in REV hardware client?

There really isn’t a lot of info here without seeing more of your robot, or you diagnosing some more things, but those are the troubleshooting steps that I would go through first.

Upside here is it’s the offseason, and you aren’t having this problem at comp (unless you are at an offseason event in which I am sorry.)

posts.name: Batu Altınay
posts.cooked: when we attach pdh there is no can device but when we atach any spark we can see every device in bus not including pdh

posts.name: Batu Altınay
posts.cooked: and no we dont have any hardware problem

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked: So, when you use a USB cable connected to a SparkMAX you can see everything on the CANbus, but when you use a USB cable connected to the PDH you can’t see anything on the CANbus?

posts.name: Ahmet Melih Şen
posts.cooked: Correction: we can’t see any device except for the SPARK itself. When we plug into the PDH there’s a ‘ CAN Bus Off’ sticky fault that can’t be cleared, and when we look at the CAN Bus we see there are about 5 Bus Off errors every second

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked: I can’t really tell from the video, is the termination switch turned on or off on your PDH ?

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked: These are the instructions for putting your PDH into recovery mode if you think that will fix it.

link_counts.title: Power Distribution Hub Troubleshooting | REV Robotics Documentation

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked: Disconnect the CAN wires from the PDH and see if you have any sticky fault when connected to the PDH then.

suggested_topics.fancy_title: Krackens and sensor suddenly not showing up
suggested_topics.title: Krackens and sensor suddenly not showing up
suggested_topics.excerpt: We found it after hours and hours. One of our zipties was pulled too tight, it cut into the casing of the wire. After we replaced it everything worked fine again.
